{{ddcl|
virtual ~basic_istream();
}}

Destructs the input stream.

===Notes===
This destructor does not perform any operation on the underlying streambuffer ({{tt|rdbuf()}}): the destructors of the derived input streams such as {{lc|std::basic_ifstream}} and {{lc|std::basic_istringstream}} are responsible for calling the destructors of the streambuffers.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

void print_stringbuf(std::streambuf* p)
{
    std::istream buf(p); // buf shares the buffer with s1
    int n;
    buf &gt;&gt; n;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; n;
} // calls the destructor of buf. p remains unaffected

int main()
{
    std::istringstream s1("10 20");
    print_stringbuf(s1.rdbuf());
    int n;
    s1 &gt;&gt; n;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; ',' &lt;&lt; n &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output= 
10,20
}}
